intro: Acomastylis turbinata f. helolochmocola, commonly known as the narrow-leaved acomastylis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, daisy-like yellow flowers. This plant is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its growth habit is usually low and spreading, forming dense mats that help prevent soil erosion. The specific epithet 'helolochmocola' refers to its unique leaf morphology, which is narrower and more elongated compared to the typical form of the species.
